entry.title: Flux Tubes and Collinear Limits
entry.summary:
While skimming through this paper, I was reminded of earlier work:

  1. An Operator Product Expansion for Polygonal null Wilson Loops
  2. Bootstrapping Null Polygon Wilson Loops
  3. Pulling the straps of polygons

This in turn lead me to more recent stuff:

  1. Space-time S-matrix and Flux-tube S-matrix at Finite Coupling
  2. Space-time S-matrix and Flux tube S-matrix II. Extracting and Matching Data
  3. Space-time S-matrix and Flux-tube S-matrix III. The two-particle contributions
  4. On the collinear limit of scattering amplitudes at strong coupling
  5. Space-time S-matrix and Flux-tube S-matrix IV. Gluons and Fusion
  6. Adjoint BFKL at finite coupling: a short-cut from the collinear limit

My task during the coming fall is to figure out if this is related in any way to my own work on scattering amplitudes.
